og.description:
AUSTIN - Beneath the ornate chandelier in a downstairs parlor at the Texas Governor's Mansion where Sam Houston once held court, Greg Abbott pondered his hand at a late-night poker game. 
Surrounded by Gov. Rick Perry, U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz, Supreme Court Justices Don Willett and Jeff Boyd, among others, Abbott's tight smile gave nothing away.
When the game ended around midnight on this balmy night in July 2013, Abbott had lost his chips, an unaccustomed outcome for a guy who admits he always plays to win - and never has lost an election.
The governor, the senator, the justices and the attorney general - Abbott has held the office for the past 11 years - adjourned to the front porch to talk sports, family and politics.
